Key Match Events: India posted a huge 199/2 in the series opener after being asked to bat first.
Sri Lanka never looked like chasing down the 200-run target as they kept losing wickets at regular intervals.
Pre-Game Insights: Dasun Shanka won the toss and decided to bowl first in the first match.
The SL team has made two changes in their eleven with Dinesh Chandimal and Jeffrey Vandersay replacing Maheesh Theekshana and Kusal Mendis.
On the other hand, India have made as many as six changes with Deepak Hooda given his T20I debut.
Rishabh Pant, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Deepak Chahar and Shardul Thakur are unavailable.

The hosts, after wrapping a 3-0 win over West Indies in Kolkata, will be aiming to continue the winning juggernaut against Sri Lanka in the first T20I at Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium on Thursday.
Post-Match Reflections: Sanju Samson, Ruturaj Gaikwad, Shreyas Iyer, Ishan Kishan and Avesh Khan to present their skillsets ahead of the Men’s T20 World Cup in Australia later in the year.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Harshal Patel sizzled against the West Indies, so as young leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi.
Venkatesh Iyer will be looking to continue his fine work of finishing matches at number six and giving some overs of part-time pace.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka are without Wanindu Hasaranga as the leg-spin all-rounder hasn’t recovered yet from a COVID-19 infection.
Mystery off-spinner Maheesh Theekshana is also a doubtful starter due to a hamstring niggle.
The pace department looks good with Dushmantha Chameera, Lahiru Kumara and Chamika Karunaratne.
